input.description: The name of the adapter to use to handle the request. Default adapter name: HPSMActor.

The items for the adapter request. This should be an XML document with a root element named "items" having a children "item" (to support multiple item support, we give "item" multiple times), which should contain the data necessary to execute the specific request.
Find Incident
This wrapper search out for the 'Incident' record(s) from pool of 'Incident' records in the application.
Sample Item Xml:
<items> <item> <operation-name>retrieve-incident</operation-name> <model> <keys> <incident-i-d> <value>MyIncident0021</value> <type>String</type> </incident-i-d> </keys>
<instance> <category> <value>incident</value> <type>String</type> </category> <severity> <value>1</value> <type>String</type> </severity> <primary-assignment-group> <value>Application</value> <type>String</type> </primary-assignment-group> <incident-description> <type>Array</type> <incident-description> <element> <value>First Line of Description</value> <type>String</type> </element> <element> <value>Second Line of Description</value> <type>String</type> </element> </incident-description> </incident-description> <brief-description> <value>Test Incident Title</value> <type>String</type> </brief-description> <subcategory> <value>access</value> <type>String</type> </subcategory> <product-type> <value>login failure</value> <type>String</type> </product-type> <problem-type> <value>incident</value> <type>String</type> </problem-type> <user-priority> <value>3</value> <type>String</type> </user-priority> <initial-impact> <value>2</value> <type>String</type> </initial-impact> <contact> <value>Rajat</value> <type>String</type> </contact> <service> <value>Applications</value> <type>String</type> </service> <alert-status> <value>start</value> <type>String</type> </alert-status> <contact-last-name> <value>Rajat</value> <type>String</type> </contact-last-name> <contact-first-name> <value>Arora</value> <type>String</type> </contact-first-name> <i-m-ticket-status> <value>abc</value> <type>String</type> </i-m-ticket-status> <site-category> <value>test</value> <type>String</type> </site-category> <problem-type> <value>pro</value> <type>String</type> </problem-type> <s-l-a-agreement-i-d> <value>1234</value> <type>String</type> </s-l-a-agreement-i-d> <folder> <value>TestFolder</value> <type>String</type> </folder> </instance>
</model> </item> </items>
Elements' Description:
Locating any record takes place in following manner-
The fields inside instance describe the record. Out of which some are key elements.
Following are cases,
Case1: You provide (either in <keys> or in <instance> or in both) only key then the record is uniquely located.
Case2: You provide (either in <keys> or in <instance> or in both) key element(s) along with some other elements then the record is located only by key elements. All other fields (elements) get ignored. Record would get uniquely located as we’re providing the key element(s).
Case3: You provide (either in <keys> or in <instance> or in both) only those elements that are not key. Then the record is located by logically ANDing all those elements with the corresponding elements of existing record.
Case4: You don’t provide anything. Then all company records would be fetched.
NOTE: When we provide some element(s) (which are not key) in <keys> element then we’re forcibly saying that “search the record(s) with these key elements (the elements in <keys> element.)” In such cases, the elements given inside <instance> element are simply ignored.
NOTE: For a given pattern string P is said to be matched with text string T if the string P is prefix string of T. for example,
P = xyz T = xyz123 Then P is matched with T.
If, P = xyz T = 1xyz23 Then P is not matched with T.
etc.
this means, if you’re searching for vendor, and you’ve given vendor name to be “abc” and if there are two records with vendor name “abc123” and “abc456” then both these record would be fetched.
(this is solely application specific.)
Complete Elements’ Description:
NOTE: The element <incident-i-d> is used as key.
Item [Required]:
This is a child of <items>. This <item> tag can be multiple times to support "multiple items support".
Operation-name [Required]:
This shows, what operation you want to perform.
Valid values: <operation-name>retrieve-incident</operation-name> is valid operation name element.
model [Required]: It is the parent tag for containing all other tags.
keys [Required]: used to ask application to search for the record with the elements inside it.
Instance [Required]: It can have many children. The children of this element describe fields of a record.
Resolution-fix-type [Optional]: To keep information whether the resolution fixed type is permanent or temporary.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden normally. When we close the record, this field gets exposed (as radio button) at location Activities > Action/Resolution > Fix Type.
Valid Values: permanent, temporary
Default Value: This field is necessary when we make chenges.
Incident-i-d [Optional]: The ID of the record.
Name of this element in the application: Incident Number (Header Information.)
Valid Values: Any unique string.
Default Value: Auto generated an unique string.
Category [Optional]: The category of the record.
Name of this element in the application: Incident Details > Category.
Valid Values: complaint incident request for change request for information
Open-time [Optional]: The date-time when the record was opened.
Name of this element in the application: History > Opened (At)
Valid Values: Any input in the DateTime format.
The DateTime format is-
YYYY.MM.DD HH:MM:SS YYYY -> Year MM -> Month DD -> Date HH -> Hours (24 hours system) MM -> Minutes SS -> Seconds.
Example, 2008.11.01 08:00:00
Default Value: Auto generated current date-time.
Opened-by [Optional]: The person, opening the record.
Name of this element in the application: History > Opened (By)
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: the user of web-service (e.g., falcon)
Severity [Optional]: The severity (urgency) of the record.
Name of this element in the application: Incident Detail > Urgency.
Valid Values: 1, 2, 3, 4 1 -> Critical, 2 -> high, 3 -> average, 4 ->low
Updated-time[Optional]: The time at which update (last) was done.
Name of this field in the application: History > Last Update (At)
Valid Values: Any Input in DateTime format.
Valid Values: any input in date time format. The DateTime format is-
YYYY.MM.DD HH:MM:SS YYYY -> Year MM -> Month DD -> Date HH -> Hours (24 hours system) MM -> Minutes SS -> Seconds.
Example, 2008.11.01 08:00:00
Default Value: The hp-service manager server maintains this field.
Note: One should not try to populate/update this field. The hp-service manager server maintains this field itself. In fact, one can't populate/modify it (it's read only field.) However, one can use this field during retrieving.
Primary-assignment-group [Optional]: the primary assignment group.
Name of this element in the application: Incident Details > Assignment Group
Valid Values:
Application E-mail / Webmail (Africa) E-mail / Webmail (Asia) E-mail / Webmail (Australia) E-mail / Webmail (Europe) E-mail / Webmail (North America) E-mail / Webmail (South America) Field Support (Africa) Field Support (Asia) Field Support (Australia) Field Support (Europe) Field Support (North America) Field Support (South America) Hardware Intranet / Internet Support (Africa) Intranet / Internet Support (Asia) Intranet / Internet Support (Australia) Intranet / Internet Support (Europe) Intranet / Internet Support (North America) Intranet / Internet Support (South America) Network Office Supplies (Africa) Office Supplies (Asia) Office Supplies (Australia) Office Supplies (Europe) Office Supplies (North America) Office Supplies (South America) Office Support (Africa) Office Support (Asia) Office Support (Australia) Office Support (Europe) Office Support (North America) Office Support (South America) Operating System Support (Africa) Operating System Support (Asia) Operating System Support (Australia) Operating System Support (Europe) Operating System Support (North America) Operating System Support (South America) SAP Support (Africa) SAP Support (Asia) SAP Support (Australia) SAP Support (Europe) SAP Support (North America) SAP Support (South America) Service Desk Service Manager
Note : The valid values for Primary Assignment Group can be customized using the Application GUI. You can navigate to System Definitions -> Tables -> assignment to modify the values.
closed-time [Optional]: the date when the record was closed.
Name of this element in the application: History > Closed (At)
Valid Values: any input in date time format. The DateTime format is-
YYYY.MM.DD HH:MM:SS YYYY -> Year MM -> Month DD -> Date HH -> Hours (24 hours system) MM -> Minutes SS -> Seconds.
Example, 2008.11.01 08:00:00
Default Value: “”, if the record was not closed. But if it was updated, then hp-service-manager server will maintain the field according to its date-time.
closed-by [Optional]: the person closing the record.
Name of this element in the application: History > closed (By)
Valid Vales: Any string.
Default Value: the user of web-service (e.g., falcon)
closure-code [Optional]: The close code.
Name of this element in the application: Incident Detail -> Closure Code.
Valid Values:
Not Reproducible Out of Scope Request Rejected Solved by Change/Service Request Solved by User Instruction Solved by Workaround Unable to solve Withdrawan by User
affected-item [Optional]: The configuration item (defected) for which the incident was raised.
Name of this element in the application: Affected Items > Affected CI.
Valid Values: Any existing configuration item.
incident-description [Optional]: The description to the incident. Note, It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element[Optional]: each element shows one line of incident-description field.
Name of this element in the application: Incident Details > Incident Description.
Valid Values: any string.
Default Values: One must have to enter at least one line (one <element> of the item xml.)
resolution [Optional]: The resolution information (description that was entered after resolving the issue.) Note, It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element[Optional]: each element shows one line of resolution field.
Name of this element in the application: Incident Detail -> Solution.
Valid Values: any string.
Default Values: “”
assignee-name [Optional]: The name of assignee.
Name of this element in the application: Assignment > Assignee.
Valid Values: You can select any pre-existing contact record (provided the assignee-name is member of primary assignment group (<primary-assignment-group>)).
Default Value: “”
contact [Optional]: The contact person.
Name of this element int the application: Hidden. Valid Values: Any valid/existing contact record.
journal-updates [Optional] : The journal updates' description. Note, It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
element[Optional]: Each element shows one line of 'journal-update' field.
Name of this element in the application: Activities > Journal Updates.
Valid Values: any string.
Default Values: “”
alert-status [Optional]: The alert status.
Name of the element in the application: Hidden
Valid Values: Any string.
contact-last-name[Optional]: The contact person's last name.
Name of this element in the application: Contact > Full Name (second column)
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: This field gets populated according to the 'Name' information information provided in the selected <contact>.
Note: Essentially, this field is populated according to the 'Name' information provided in the selected <contact>. So, directly (during the creation of the incident record), user don't have control over this field to populate/modify this field with random string.
contact-first-name [Optional]: The contact person's first name.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
company [Optional] : The company information.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
brief-description [Optional]: The brief description of the indent record.
Name of this element in the application: Incident Title.
Valid Values: Any string.
ticket-owner [Optional] : The ticket (incident record) owner.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: The web-server user (e.g., falcon.)
Note: This field can't be populated/modified from hp-service-manager client user interface application.
Updated-by [Optional]: The person who is updating the record.
Name of this element in the application: History > Last Updated (By.)
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: The hp-service manager server maintains this field.
Note: One should not try to populate/update this field. The hp-service manager server maintains this field itself. In fact, one can't update/modify it (it's read only field.) However, one can use this field during retrieving.
IMTicket-status[Optional]: The status of incident management ticket (the incident.)
Name of this element in the application: Status.
Valid Values: Any String
Note : Application provides a List Box with the following values for this field : Closed Pending Other Referred Replaced Problem Resolved Open Accepted Rejected Work In Progress Pending Customer Pending Vendor Pending Change
Default Value: Same as value given to <i-m-ticket-status> element.
Note: One can't populate/modify this directly. However, one can populate/modify this field by providing the value in the <i-m-ticket-status> element. Note, one can use this field during retrieving.
subcategory [Optional]: The area of the selected category of the record.
Name of this element in the application: Incident Details > Area.
Valid Values: For every <category> there are several <subcategory> and for every <subcategory> there are several <product-type> element values.
For testing purpose one may use following- category: incident subcategory: access product-type: login failure
SLAAgreement-i-d[Optional]: The SLA Agreement ID of incident management ticket (the incident.)
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any decimal value.
Default Value: Same as value given to <s-l-a-agreement-i-d> element.
Note: One can't populate/modify this directly. However, one can populate/modify this field by providing the value in the <s-l-a-agreement-i-d> element. Note, one can use this field during retrieving.
site-category [Optional]: The site Category of the record.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any String.
product-type[Optional]: The product type.
Name of this element in the application: Incident Details > Sub Area.
Valid Values: For every <category> there are several <subcategory> and for every <subcategory> there are several <product-type> element values.
For testing purpose one may use following- category: incident subcategory: access product-type: login failure
problem-type [Optional]: The problem type.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Note : You can't populate/modify this directly. This contains the same value of <category> element.
resolution-fix-type [Optional]: The resolution fixed type.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
user-priority [Optional]: The priority given by the user (for own referencing) while opening the ticket.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
location[Optional]: The location information for the configuration item.
Name of this element in the application: Affected Items > Location.
Valid Values: Africa Asia Australia Europe North America South America
solution [Optional]: The solution's description.
Note, It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element[Optional]: each element shows one line of solution field (expected scenario.)
Name of this element in the application: Solution.
Valid Values: Any string.
Note : This is same as <resolution> element.
initial-impact [Optional]: the initial impact of the record.
Name of this element in the application: Incident Details > Impact.
Valid Values: 1, 2, 3, 4 1 -> Enterprise, 2 -> Site/Dept, 3 -> Multiple User, 4 -> User.
S-l-a-agreement-i-d [Optional]: The ID of SLA agreement.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: : Any integer values.
I-m-ticket-status [Optional]: the status of the ticket (incident.)
Name of this element in the application: Ticket Status.
Valid Values: Open Pending other work in progress Reject Resolved Pending vendor Closed Pending customer Referred Replaced Problem
Or, you can take your own string. For example “MyRandomString”. Ideally, this facility should not be there because on the hp-service-manager client user interface application it is showing to be 'enum' type of field and thus should take some specific values only.
Default Value: Open.
folder [Optional]: Specifies the folder of the incident.
Name of this element in the application : Hidden.
Valid Values : Any String.
service [Optional]: Specifies the service of the incident.
Name of this element in the application : Service.
Valid Values :
Applications E-mail / Webmail (Africa) E-mail / Webmail (Asia) E-mail / Webmail (Australia) E-mail / Webmail (Europe) E-mail / Webmail (North America) E-mail / Webmail (South America) Education Handheld, PDA & Telephony Intranet / Internet (Africa) Intranet / Internet (Asia) Intranet / Internet (Australia) Intranet / Internet (Europe) Intranet / Internet (North America) Intranet / Internet (South America) MyDevices Printing (Africa) Printing (Asia) Printing (Australia) Printing (Europe) Printing (North America) Printing (South America) Service Management
Status [Optional]: The alert status.
Name of the element in the application: Alert Status
Valid Values: Any string.
Default value: Application maintains this field according to the status of the ticket, like “open”, “closed”, “updated” etc.

Provide username/password in form of xml.
This input parameter is required when the user wants to override the default values for username and password provided in the adapter configuration. This is required for cases where an operation cannot be executed with the default username/password provided in the adapter configuration and only user with special permissions can execute the operation. Examples of such operations can be - 'approve-change', 'deny-change', 'close-change', 'approve-task'
Sample XML Format:
<connection-parameters> <alternate-username>USERNAME</alternate-username> <alternate-password>PASSWORD</alternate-password> </connection-parameters>

output.description: The adapter response containing the results.

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="no" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <request-data> <hp-service-manager-request> <xsl:if test="string('${username}') != ''"> <username>${username}</username> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string('${username}') != ''"> <password>${password}</password> </xsl:if> <entity> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">incident</xsl:text> </entity> <entity-type> <xsl:copy-of select="(//entity-type)[1]/text()" /> </entity-type> <request> <operation-name> <xsl:copy-of select="(//operation-name)[1]/text()" /> </operation-name> <xsl:for-each select="/items/item"> <parameters> <xsl:element name="${request element}"> <xsl:copy-of select="./model" /> </xsl:element> </parameters> </xsl:for-each> </request> </hp-service-manager-request> </request-data> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description:
Find Incident
This wrapper search out for the 'Incident' record(s) from pool of 'Incident' records in the application.
